item.title: Classical logic
item.description: Its invention is attributed to Aristotle. Its content was given a mathematical form in the early 20th century, by Gottlob Frege and later Bertand Russell.

item.title: Predicate logic
item.description: Also known as first-order logic, is an extension of propositional logic (then referred to as zeroth-order logic). This introduces predicates, and quantifiers over objects other than propositions.
